intro: Pavonia mollis, commonly known as the silky pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of pink to red flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Pavonia mollis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and blooms.
